content:
Downvoted :(

* Duplicate --> https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/364059bc02b65fd3ef9962067f06338bc38 (The same concept can be used to solve both with minor tweak)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I've seen the sum of numbers. This one is far more interesting as it makes you think a little bit more. So there's no reason the sum of numbers should be allowed and this not.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Straight forward. I wouldn't mind having this as a reverse clash in all honesty. Not too easy either especially since it's supposed to be clash

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: this is quite easy as you are giving the instructions 
reverse would be good but the way it is rn it is too easy
OK for Fastest and Shortest, but in Reverse, this is a horrible "Here's a bunch of numbers. Guess!" puzzle.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple and clear

Personally, I think the first sentence as it is now is sufficient, and the example is unnecessary. I also think that you don't need to add a constraint for K. In any case, here's my proofreading:

Statement:
Given a number [[N]], sum up all even numbers from 2 to [[N]] (inclusive).

Output:
<<Line 1:>> The sum [[K]] of all even numbers in the range [2, [[N]]].

If you use variables  (like N or K), don't just write N, but [[N]]. Then it's automatically marked as variable. That makes it easier to read. I added that for you.

I like, that you give an example, but you should explain it more. I can also read the first Testcase and I have the same information.
My suggestion:
Example for [[N]] = 10:
All even numbers from 2 to [[N]]: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10
Output: 2 + 4 + 6 + 8 + 10 = 30

I agree with you, I´m new in this site I have to read the contribution guide more.

I think this Hint in the example is not necessary because the statement is very short and easy to understand also it is easy traverse a range of number and check if a number is even or not, this problem does not have TLE so with a simple loop can be solved, give a range in the example is trivial.

Thank you for your feedback!

You will always see differences of opinion, the comment below suggests that I add something to the example and you say that the example is not necessary, so I prefer a stability that is to leave the example but not go so deep.

The limit given for the integer [[K]] is not necessary because it does not even cause an overflow but I think that setting it does not affect the problem at all.

Thank you for your feedback.

It is my pleasure to contribute here.
Thank you.

I think same.

Thank you for your feedback.

Where I give the instructions? In the statement? What problem does not have a statement? The problem is quite easy but it has two soluction Loop vs Math, the math soluction is more faster to implement and more shortest so definitely this problem is FASTEST and SHORTEST mode.

Thank you for your feedback.
Yes, you don't have to give an example. The statement is clear enough. I just meant, if you give one, explain it too.
